divs: sighting details it was saturday, sept. 17, 2005 at around 10:00pm. i stepped outside to have a cigarette. i immediately noticed what looked like a bright, orange star in the horizon. i sat and watched it, never taking my eyes off it. it hovered for about 2 minutes, then slowly moved down and to the left. then it moved back to its origional position. then it moved slowly down and to the right. it looked suspicious to me, and i knew it wasn't a helicopter or an airplane. it made no noise. i ran inside to get my camcorder, i was only gone for about 15 seconds. when i came back out the object was considerably closer to where i was. i started filming it, and zoomed in on it. it appeared to be a circular, large object, and it was on fire. the fire coming off it was so bright it lit up the sky. the object was decending slowly, and away from my position. it was leaving a trail of smoke and fire behind it, but the object remained intacked. it also appeared to be pulsating a white light as it was on fire as well. at that point, it could have been mistaken for a comet, but comets dont hover. it continued to decend away from me, and then hovered above the tree line of a wooded area about 3\4 mile from me. it didn't crash or explode. it landed softly and quietly in the woods. while it was on the ground, it still was very bright and glowing. within a few seconds, all the fire and light on the object went out completely. i sat and waited to hear sirens or people screaming, but nothing happened! how could i be the only one to see this! i waited till about midnight, but no sign of it taking back off or relighting. i am worried it is still there. monday morning i took the tape to kxxv news channel 25. i showed the footage to newsreporter keba arnold. she was shocked when she saw the tape, and didn't know what it was, either. she said she was going to call the local pd and the military to see what she could find out. i called her later that day and she said she sent her copy of the footage to their waco office. she said a producer up there thought it was a flare! this thing is huge and it hovered and moved around! if you want to see the footage you can reach keba at 254-526-6720. and it wasn't a flare or helicopter, or airplane, or comet, or hot air balloon, or the goodyear blimp. i hope you have better luck with it than i did.
